164501.name: (Unusual) Orc Habits and 1d100 of them
164501.description:
From publisher blurb:

Alphabet Soup is a comprehensive guide to words commonly (and uncommonly) found in games or used by gamers. It provides quick, easy definitions in lexicon form: gaming terms, definitions, historical context, mythological terms. It even gives gamemasters advice on how they can use them in their games. It works like an encyclopedia of random bits, only these random bits are things I think are interesting for gamemasters.

In this particular edition, I've provided a 1d100 chart of orc behaviors, habits, and mannerisms that will flesh out any fantasy game.

164502.description:
A collection of 12 deluxe scenarios and 7 new deluxe boards for Advanced Squad Leader.

The scenario locations, belligerents and dates are as follows:

- San River east of Krakow, Poland, 8 September 1939: Poles / German
- Ste. Marie du Mont, France, 6 June 1944: German / US
- MAYU RANGE, West of Buthidaung, Burma, April 28, 1943: British / Japanese
- Tanapag Plain, Saipan, July 6 1944; Japanese / US
- Meiktila, Burma 1st March 1945: Japanese / Gurkhas
- Central Burma, March 1945: this is a 3 player scenario with Indian National Army, Japanese and Burma National Army
- Saipan, Northern Mariana Islands. July 6, 1944: Japanese / US (includes Caves, but Cave complexes are NA by SSR)
- Saint Omer, France, 23 May 1940: German / British
- “Scraggy” - Shenam Pass, 20th April 1944: British / Japanese
- North of Donbaik, Burma, 18 March 1943:Japanese / British
- Namur, Marshalls, near Natalie Point, February 2 1944: Japanese / USMC
- Ivantseva, USSR, 24 February 1942: German / Russian

Only one of the 12 scenarios will use a map not found in the pack, which is the official map "e".
164502.name: Advanced Squad Leader: Deluxe Pack 1

164503.name: Rallye Monte Carlo: Renault N°1
164503.description:
A race game for 2 to 4 player.

Every player decide to start their race from: London, Rome, Hamburg, Paris. Roll a dice (1d6) and move your own car, read the description on the arrival point and make what happens!

The road will merge all the players in Montpellier and start the final race to Montecarlo.
But not enough for win the race arrive first to the finish in Monaco, when all players have arrived, you will do two laps in the famous "Col de Turini" in the night stage.
The player with the most points in 2 rounds will be the winner!

Be faster than everyone!

164504.name: World Empire II Deluxe
164504.description:
From the game's electronic manual

World Empire II Deluxe is a game that blends strategy and luck to achieve world conquest. The object of the game is simple: defeat the other players (human or computer) and conquer the world!

You begin the game with 56 Armies (actually divisions) in normal mode or 30 Armies in expert mode, all placed in a randomly selected country. Your strategy will likely be heavily influenced by this initial positioning. You can only attack countries that border a country that you already own. Also, attacking one continent from another can only be done from certain countries. For example, an attack launched at Asia from Europe can only be accomplished through the Ukraine - an attack launched at Africa can only be accomplished through Spain.

Also at the beginning of the game, each player is assigned an IDEOLOGY, or set of beliefs, for which he will fight for the duration of the game. A randomly selected number of countries around the world are also assigned that player's ideology. These ideologically "friendly" countries are easier to conquer than those who are friendly to another player. They also require only ONE army of occupation.

The winner of individual attacks is determined randomly by electronically throwing dice (though you don't see this). If you get the highest result, you win. If these "dice" come up doubles and the country you are attacking shares your ideology, then you win the battle. If, however, that country shares someone else's ideology you lose the tie.


User Summary

The game was released as shareware with the full game available via mail order. Features in the registered version included a real-world simulation mode based on country population, and the option to play up to seven AI opponents (maximum of two in the shareware version).

164505.name: Kennst Du den
164505.description:
Here's your chance to prove how much you know about cars. 120 photos show all sorts of car types from all makes.

Of course it's not just about knowing as many cars as possible. If you're really sharp, you'll also know what's "under the bonnet". You'll find all of this on the back of the cards: top speed, horse power, acceleration, engine size, number of cylinders and weight.

This German game is part of the Quartett series and can be played using Quartett rules. However, the game may also be played with Supertrumf rules by using the different car statistics printed on the back of each card.

164506.description:
As a medieval monk, you are charged with increasing the prestige of the abbey's collection of historical and sacred texts. By acquiring the resources for manuscript illustration and reproduction, your abbey produces and sells its valuable works, thereby bringing in finances necessary for maintaining a fine abbey. Will you succeed in making your abbey the most prestigious of all?

Biblios Dice is a revision of Scripts and Scribes: The Dice Game, which is itself a dice version of Biblios (originally called Scripts and Scribes).

The object is to acquire gold and to collect resources – scrolls, manuscripts, pigments, quills, ink – to exchange for gold. The follows the same basic theme as Biblios, but with interesting changes due to the use of dice. As in Scripts and Scribes, players compete in five different categories and the values of the categories change during the game. In addition, depending upon the dice roll, there may be many or few auctions during the game in which players auction their resources for gold or auction gold for resources.

Biblios Dice differs from its earlier version Scripts and Scribes: The Dice Game in a few important ways. Regarding the production and components, Biblios Dice has much nicer artwork, the game board has been divided into separate boards, and the resource dice are etched. Regarding the rules, Biblios Dice has a few important changes. The goal of the game is now to collect the most VPs, rather than gold. There is only one type of auction in this game and the first and second place winners of the auction get dice (not winner take all). The auctions also do not happen as randomly, but can be predicted based upon the progress of the mule on the market board.
164506.name: Biblios Dice

164507.name: Yoostar 2 in the Movies
164507.description: Yoostar 2 is a game playable only with the Kinect. Choose your character and play in a Hollywood movie. Follow the script or improvise. Now you have the opportunity to become a global movie star: in an instant you can step into the shoes of famous characters from hundreds of movies, play out the part and then share your performance with the world.

164508.name: Nerf
164508.description:
Nerf is a children's card game, part of the "Shuffle" line of games.

There are two types of cards; Target Cards and Dart Cards. The game involves matching the colors of the top Dart card from your deck to one of the Target cards on the table. It is a game of speed, just like the classic game of Snap.

Each target card has a point value and the winner is the person who scores the most from matching their Dart cards with Target cards.

An App is available, with extra gameplay & quickstart.

164509.name: Spectre (1982)
164509.description:
User Summary

This Pac-Man clone has a first person perspective as well as the top-down view. After a few seconds, The walls on the top-down view are blacked out. During an advanced game, The walls and the dots are removed forcing the player to use the first person perspective exclusively. The Spectres look like something from the movie "Tron".

164510.name: Schnauferl Reise: Oldtimer Rallye
164510.description: The players start at space 1 and have to get to the finish line at space 22, while minding the traffic rules. Movement is determined by a die. On their way, the players get winning points awarded or penality points imposed. The last points are awarded for reaching the finish line (12 points for the first, 6 points for the second and 3 points for the third player). The player who gets the most points (after substracting the penality points) wins the game.

164511.name: Pandora's Box (1983)
164511.description:
User Summary

As a cloud you, Zeus, have come to earth to clean up Pandora's mess. Wander the lands a zap the monsters with your lighting bolt and put them back into the box. But watch out for the giant vultures! They are the only one that can harm you as a cloud and you only have three incarnations to do your job.

164512.name: Marauder (1982)
164512.description:
User Summary

As an elite forces combat specialist you must penetrate the defenses of an enemy bases and destroy its' power stations.

First you must fly in and engage any artillery placements, Destroy the force field and land safely. Then you enter the base, locate the power stations, Take them off line and engage any base personnel. Good Luck.

164513.name: Masquerade
164513.description:
From the packaging

It turned out to be the toughest case of your detective career. Clues have lead to nothing but dead ends. Nobody is talking. Meanwhile, The crime boss you are after is still operating from somewhere. You are about to throw in the towel. But wait! Something breaks. You trail a stooge of the crime organization to a cheap, shoddy hotel, hoping to pump some answer out of him. You break into the hotel room and with the butt end of your trusty .44 magnum, you knock him out cold. This could be the lead you've waited for. Maybe, just maybe, if you could find some clues...

This is a text adventure game with graphics.

164515.description:
The monument Phaistos was lost during the development of the game — but now it's part of the game again!

With Monuments: Wonders of Antiquity – Phaistos: The Lost Monument, nine additional cards are available for building Phaistos by each player (not only two of them). To get a Phaistos card, you must pay another card with a matching symbol. Each card is worth 6 points when being a part of a history (instead of 3 for the others).

Phaistos: The Lost Monument is the sixth expansion for Monuments: Wonders of Antiquity and was limited to 1,000 pieces that were available at SPIEL 2014.
164515.name: Monuments: Wonders of Antiquity – Phaistos: The Lost Monument

164516.name: Muramasa Rebirth - Genroku Legends: Hell's Where the Heart Is
164516.description:
User Summary

A former monk named Seikichi accidentally proposes to the daughter of the Lord of Hell, Rajyaki. Already on a mission to recover the sacred treasures of the Seven Gods of Fortune that she misplaced, Rajyaki stuffs Seikichi in a magical bag and continues her mission, all while being the best fiancée she can be.

rpgitemversion.249737: Aventuras en la Marca del Este: Lo que el ojo no ve

164517.name: Aventuras en la Marca del Este: Lo que el ojo no ve

rpg.10154: Aventuras en la Marca del Este

164517.description:
From the back cover:

The Royal Forest, near Marvalar, has always been a peaceful place to live. Until now. This tranquility is disturbed by a series of abductions by an army of goblins especially cruel and disciplined. As if that were not enough, a strange curse is decimating the population of the nearby town of Castamir, making its inhabitants flee in terror.

What dark truth hides behind these events? It is time for a group of heroes to step forward and face the unknown ... to what the eye does not see.

"What the eye does not see" is a module for Adventures in the East Mark designed for a party of 1-5 adventurers of levels 1 and 2.

rpgitemversion.249738: Aventuras en la Marca del Este: El Enclave

164518.name: Aventuras en la Marca del Este: El Enclave

rpg.10154: Aventuras en la Marca del Este

164518.description:
From the back cover:

The Enclave is the first of three adventures designed for a basic game play with Adventures in the East Mark. This adventure is designed to be played by four or five characters with low levels in which adventurers must face some of the most terrible monsters circulating in the Great Swamp region.

164519.name: Tower War
164519.description:
A two-player game with Looney Pyramids and playing cards. Players each begin with a stash of 15 Looney Pyramids, and draft 15-card individual decks from a standard 54-card deck (13 cards in each suit, plus 2 jokers).

They then play in battles of three skirmishes each, where the high card determines the winner of each skirmish. The loser of a skirmish contributes a pyramid to the tower, and the loser of a battle contributes any further pyramids needed to complete a set of three, plus a card to raise the tower to its next level. If a player is unable to play a pyramid, or knocks over the tower, his opponent wins.

164520.name: Sebba Three
164520.description:
User Summary

Fly through the levels and collect magical gems to increase score. But you can only fly until your flight meter is depleted. Defeat enemies along the way using the super dash.

164521.name: Sebba 2
164521.description:
User Summary

Fly around the levels and collect coins. You can also find other objects that can assist you in the game. Watch your flight time! Platforms can be flown through from underneath, but will support you if stood on and approached from above.

164522.name: DreamCatcher
164522.description:
User Summary

Move the dreamcatcher around and get points for catching the blue shapes. But watch out! There are also red shapes, and they will heavily reduce your score. Try to score as many points as you can.

164523.name: Higher and Higher
164523.description:
User Summary

Jump onto the platforms. Try to score a lot of points. There are four game versions. Hard where you have one minute and the ground falls fast. Style where only stylish jumps earn points. Speed where you try to get as high as you can in two minutes. Endurance where you try to jump as high as you can.

164524.name: Airline the Card Game
164524.description:
Airline the Card Game is the new pocket sized Route matching game. Assume the role of a CEO trying to grow a fledgling Airline into a mammoth, business juggernaut. Aggressively expand your Airline's Routes to "Control the skies!"

The first player to expand to 5 cities wins!

Player Choices - Airline the Card Game offers a plethora of choices. Deciding whether to play a Special card, City card with matching Airplane, drawing cards, or discarding to draw even more, the choice is yours!

Fast Setup - Setup time is a serious concern on choosing what game to play, especially route building games. With Airline the Card Game you are set up and ready to go in less than a minute. It's also easy to learn and cleans up quickly too!

Route Matching - The popular play style of Airline the Card Game is something that will interest both novice and experienced tabletop gamers alike. Plus it's all packaged in a portable, pint sized, tuckbox, so you can take it with you anywhere!

164525.name: Save Me 2
164525.description:
User Summary

Two buildings are simultaneously burning. And there are only two firemen for both. Spend your time trying to catch survivors jumping from windows rather than putting out the fire. Save people animals and objects, but watch out for objects that can kill!

164526.name: Killerbanjo PingPong
164526.description:
User Summary

Bounce the ball against the platform you control. Move two directions, both left and right! You have five lives, so can miss four times before your game is over. Try to score as many points as you can. Get one point each time you hit the ball.

164527.name: Line Game
164527.description:
User Summary

Guide your cursor through the maze. Avoid touching the sides! There are many obstacles and shifting features to watch out for. There are eight levels to choose from.

164528.name: Letterati
164528.description:
User Summary

A bunch of letters appear on the screen. Type in the corresponding letters to clear them.

164529.description:
This game reminds us how important henchmen are when it comes to attaching lasers to sharks and getting things done that we don’t want to get caught doing ourselves! Henchmen are the backbone of society but they’re never appreciated and are often killed, strangled, beat up, or even shot off of high ledges...and this game won't be any different!

3 to 6 players will work with or against each other to earn as much ca$h as possible before the end of the game in order to please Da Boss but watch out, taking on a job could alert the Super Jerk who won't think twice to kill half of everyone's henchmen! If 5 Super Jerks are revealed, the game will end and the player with the most ca$h will be declared the winner.

Henchmen! is a fun, easy to learn game that is fast paced and has great replay value. The art was all done by the game's designer Daniel Lanza and was styled to be a call-back to famous television shows and movies of the 80's and 90's that truly emphasized the henchmen stereotype we all grew up loving.

We hope you enjoy this truly unique game!
164529.name: Henchmen!

164530.description:
This product supports the Command at Sea (CaS) supplement Rising Sun, which provides scenarios covering the first half of WW II in the Pacific (December 1941 - November 1943). A Form 10 lists all the statistics for the ship, along with weapon ranges and hit chances, sensor ranges, maneuvering data, and a damage tracking form - all the information needed to use that ship in a CaS game.
Consisting of over 360 separate Form 10s, it provides the ships needed for all the surface battles in the Rising Sun scenario booklet. And the ships are listed in their exact configuration for each scenario. If a ship was refitted between one battle and the next, it has a form for before and after.
There are no carriers or submarines, only the surface ships, and only in the configurations needed for the scenarios in Rising Sun. There are no rules included. Players will need the CaS 4th edition rules to use these Forms.
164530.name: Rising Sun Form 10s

11429.name: The Rising Sun: Command at Sea Volume I

164531.name: Gamemastery Treasure Chest
164531.description:
From Back of Box:

Become the Master of Your Game!
The GameMastery Treasure Chest (TM) is packed foull of Tools you need to take your game to the next level. Inside you'll get:
Critical Hit Deck
Item Cards: Elements of Power
Map Pack: Inns
Campaign Workbook
Flip-Mat: Woodlands
Module TC1: Into the Haunted Forest

164532.name: Goblin Toboggan
164532.description:
A ‘take-that’ fantasy themed, tile-laying, route-building, downhill avalanche racing game, featuring a deck of mischief cards that allow 2-6 players to manipulate the board for their benefit and their opponents’ demise.

Each round, players add a new row to the track, rotating each tile they play to their own advantage. Once the tiles are placed the movement phase begins. Players utilize the effects of their mischief cards to give themselves an edge and humiliate their opponents to stay in the lead and outrun the avalanche, which rushes down the mountain destroying tiles and goblin toboggans in its wake.

164533.name: Mazestone Dungeon
164533.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Swords & Wizardry Mini-Dungeon
For 4-6 Adventurers of Levels 4-6

The king’s wizard is dead. His legendary mazestone has been stolen. The good news is its been located in the castle’s dungeon. The bad news is the maze has escaped, along with the monsters it contained...

Mazestone Dungeon is fourth in a series of mini-dungeons designed to drop into existing adventures or campaigns. Use them as side quests or a way of getting in a quick adventure when you’re short on time.

This adventure is part of our Dungeons of Dazegoneby series, a new line of products created with ‘old school’ gaming in mind. If you like this adventure watch for other Dungeons of Dazegoneby mini-dungeons coming soon.

164534.name: Control
164534.description:
User Summary

In this side scrolling game you control two parallel lines with the arrow keys. Press up to move them up and down to move them down. Avoid the line! Each time you hit the line you lose a life. The longer you last the more points you score.

164535.name: Cosmic Blast
164535.description:
User Summary

Try to get through the levels in this shooter game. Shoot the planets to pass levels and refill the power bar. Move freely and fire bullets. But targets are auto picked by the game.

164536.name: Barricade (Web browser)
164536.description:
User Summary

Move your ship left and right to block falling bombs. Each bomb you block gives you a bomb you can place on the screen. Combine blocking the bombs with your ship and with bombs to score points.

164537.name: Flying Catch
164537.description:
User Summary

Fly into as many K's as you can in this sidescrolling flying game! The more K's you catch, the higher your score.

164538.name: Manta Claus
164538.description:
User Summary

This manta ray has decided to hijack Christmas! Throw presents down chimney's for points. Avoid trucks, cars and bicycles. Getting hit will end the game. Also watch out for angry Santa! Throw presents at him to take him out.

164539.name: Dödsklotets Hemlighet
164539.description:
User summary

The first Zone compendium for Mutant: År Noll:
It contains two new zones to play in:

Bron över Skrotsundet (The Bridge over the Junk Channel)
Vinterzonen (Winter Zone)




And four new zone sectors:

Frö av ondska (Seeds of Evil)
Dödsklotets hemlighet (The Secret of the Death Globe)
Familjens villa (The Family Villa)
När knoppar spricka (When Buds Burst)




Also contains maps and a random monster generator.

rpgitemversion.359526: Manual de Zona 1: La Guarida de los Saurios PDF version

164540.name: I Reptilfolkets Spår
164540.description:
User summary

The second Zone compendium for Mutant:År Noll.
It contains:

One new Zone, Musközonen
Four zone sectors written by prominent swedish RPG writers
A map of the entire Mutant scandinavia and rules for long distance travel
New artifacts to use in a game

164541.name: Tic Tac Toe Attack
164541.description:
Tic Tac Toe Attack is yet another take on the traditional game.

Each player set aside a deck of 25 cards, containing two sets of number cards running from 1 to 12, plus a wild card (Each player plays with a different set, so the total number of cards in the box is 50). At the beginning of the game, each player is dealt a hand of six cards. Each player now takes turns, playing one card on the 3x3 grid on the table and replenishing back to six. The crucial thing is that you can play your card on top of your opponent's card on the grid as long as the number on your card is higher than the existing number on grid. The Wild card counts as the highest number when you play, the lowest when it is already on the table.

Whenever you make a three in a row with your played cards, you score 1. Anyone who scores 5 first wins the game.

164542.name: Expeditie Robinson
164542.description:
Two teams consisting of six tribe members each land on a desert island. They try to survive by exploring the island and collecting provisions, with each team doing their best to outsmart their rivals. The teams face off in exciting elimination challenges. After the tribes have merged it’s every player for himself. Players individually vote for those tribe members with whom they’ll try to keep going as long as possible. Will you survive this bloodcurdling knock-out race? Who among you is the true Survivor?

Goal of the game:
The player who, after the Merge, has cast the most votes for the last standing tribe member wins Expeditie Robinson.

Game-play:
Expeditie Robinson is played in 2 phases:
1. The Team Phase (2 islands)
2. The Merge (1 island, every man for himself)

The Team Phase (2 islands)
Each team tries to accomplish 3 different missions before the Team Phase ends.

With each of the three missions the teams can earn an extra voting card to be used in the next phase.

The 3 missions
° Have more tribe members (pawns) than the opposing team.
° Have “explored” (turned over) more island tiles than the opposing team.
° Have more provisions left than the opposing team.

The teams take turns. A turn consists of two action points. There are two different actions, each costing one action point.

° Choosing an island tile
Choose one tile from the four stacks in the middle of the table and join it to the island.

° Moving a tribe member
Move a team member by one tile. It doesn't matter if the tile has been explored already. by doing this you can explore the tiles you've added and find provisions. With these provisions you can feed your tribe members and build tools.

During a turn a team can perform every possible combination of these two actions. As well as actions, you are always allowed to make a campfire and tools without the cost of action points.

Elimination challenge
Whenever the 'Elimination challenge' tile has been revealed the challenge is played. The teams each take their own sets of dice and take turns. They must try to build a tower of six dice, with “6” at the bottom, followed by “5”, then “4”, then “3”, then “2”, and finally “1” on top. The first player to succeed wins.

The Merge (1 island, every man for himself)
Players now play on individually; teams no longer exist. Each player receive voting cards for 4 votes, 2 votes. Players that belonging to the team that won a mission during the Team Phase gets 1 extra vote for every mission they won.
Voting
Players cast their votes in secret. Putting every voting card they possess into a slot in the voting tray.
On the voting tray each slot has its own color. These colors represent tribe members. Casting a vote into the red slot means voting for the red tribe member. Of course you will do what you can for your chosen tribe member to be the last one standing.

The knock-out race begins
Just as in the Team Phase, a player playing his turn has the two same action points and actions that can be used.

The players try to find food for the tribe member they voted for so they stay in the game. But not to obvious, otherwise they might get discovered and thrown out by other players.

One by one the tribe members will get eliminated. The game will continue this way until there’s only one tribe member left. This is the last standing tribe member, in other words, the true Survivor.

Now the time has come for an exciting moment − who voted for this tribe member and how many votes did he cast? The player to have cast the most votes for the Survivor, is the winner!

164543.name: Konog
164543.description:
An elegant game based off the traditional gambling game of the fierce and reclusive konog species, a secretive and xenophobic race from a remote corner of the galaxy. This game, enjoyed for years by the expeditionaries and pioneers in the Industrial Sectors, has only recently been introduced to the Core Systems.

The goal of the game is to make a number of "Konogs"; which is either three cards of the same number of any suit, or a run (1, 2, 3) of three cards of the same suit. After playing a Konog, the fourth card left in your hand is placed in front of you, this is the value of that Konog. At the end of the game (after one player has performed a sixth Konog and all other players have taken one last turn) these values are added together (plus any triumvirates) to find the player's total ending score. The player with the highest score is the winner.

Note: you will need a large plate (or a rotating tray, like a Lazy Susan) to play Konog. As a player discards, many cards will make the discard piles (one for each player) rotate in different directions. Also included in the game are wooden "sentries", you can place these on a discard pile to protect a card from being taken or covered up by another player.

Konog has many features that set it apart from other games. Inside each game box you can expect to find: simple, yet elegant artwork featured on circular cards, a completely alien numerical system based on three (don't worry, standard numbers are featured at the bottom of each card for those that are unfamiliar with the Konog numeral system), colorful wooden pieces (a sentry and matching post for each player), and a drawstring bag to hold everything.

164544.name: 1 Minute
164544.description:
1 Minute is a fun and fast-pacing party game. You're playing in two teams who will: drawing, portray and describe words to their team members. The opposing team will distribute the points across the different categories. Oh, one little problem: before you know the seconds start ticking away.

What are you waiting for, you only have 1 minute!

164545.name: Bravada
164545.description:
Gameplay:
You play a young beardless dwarf who dreams about adventures and heroic deeds. Usually dwarves have beards, but for some mystical reasons beard of our hero is not grows. So he decide to make a journey with his friend the bat to solve this problem. During the game you control a group of units each with its own specialities and features. Units can get levels and transform into other forms by your choice. Combats is turn based but fast due to clever control system.

Features:
- Fresh battle system. It is turn based but feels like an action
- Hundreds of units. And you can get anyone to your team (even foes)
- Humorous plot and unique description of every game element
- RPG-elements like inventory and unit classes
- Units evolution and selection of specialization on every 5th level-up

Source: The Developer Website.

164546.name: Niemandsland - Edition Stahlgewitter
164546.description:
publisher' description

Cthulhu in the First World War!

Edition Stahlgewitter focuses on the source and rule parts of Niemandsland: Grabenkrieg & Heimatfront, which have proven to be most important at the table.
Known for the Allies as the "Great War", and in Germany as the "world war", the inhumane slaughter of the trench war driven by belligerence of all powers is at the same time en entry from the old to the new time. The world is rearranged, but also the personal fates of those involved - including the player characters - are to be rewritten.

Included is the the adventure Sommenachtsalptraum, plying in 1916.


additional information

This is an abbrevated version of the out of print book Niemandsland: Grabenkrieg & Heimatfront.

164547.name: Grim Legends: The Forsaken Bride
164547.description:
The wind lashes against the cliff side trees, which clutch the stones like grasping fingers. Overhead a storm rages, scattering the long pillows of mist that haunt the land like ghost ships. Against this backdrop a girl is silhouetted. She is running, clutching her shawl to keep the rain out of her hair. A flash of lighting illuminates her face. She is beautiful, but she`s crying. Raindrops are mixing with the tears streaming over her cheeks. She starts to scream, but her words go lost in the wind. She trips on a root, falls to her knees. In a moment of rage and despair she pulls the small golden wedding band from her finger and tosses it off the edge of the cliff. The ring flashes and disappears into the abyss. As she walks away, she cannot see the red glow that pierces the fog and the demonic, gnarled hand that appears as if out of thin air to catch the ring as it falls.

25 years later…

Within the shadow of an ancient forest, on the bottom of the foggy valley, stands the lonely village of Ravenbrook. There lives the folk - cheerful and diligent, yet warily superstitious. They surround the Village with countless charms to keep the evil spirits at bay. For on the other side of the forest, there lies a seemingly bottomless pit, known as the Abyss. It is this place the villagers of Ravenbrook fear most...

On this night, a young woman returns home for her twin sister’s wedding. They haven’t seen each other in years.

But the ceremony is interrupted by the intrusion of a gigantic bear – a dark hero of local legend, who kidnaps the bride.

Wasting no time, and accompanied by Edward – the would-be husband of her sister - the Heroine follows the beast’s trail deep into a world of legends and magic.

The quest to find Lilly will lead her sister through a dangerous, mystical forest full of fairies and magical beings, as well as places that put an unspeakable terror into the hearts of simple folk.

Each clue leading to her kidnapped sister will bring the heroine closer to the truth about her and her sister. The main protagonist will learn that words spoken in a world where ancient magic is part of the reality have a tremendous power. The events that she will witness will make her realise, that grim legends can sometimes come into life…

Can she save her sister and discover what connects the legendary bear and a mysterious witch with the Haugwitz family curse? What will be the conclusion to this grim legend?

Main features:

- thrilling mature story with a dark secret under its surface

- deep, intriguing protagonists

- carefully crafted, unique fantasy world

- 39 captivating, hand-painted locations

- unique, varied puzzles and mini games set in the fantasy world

- fuzzy, cute sidekick - a small kitten

- enhanced "gameplay adventure”: including shooting a crossbow

- 24 achievements to unlock!

- original soundtrack

- Collectors Edition featuring an additional adventure and other bonuses

Source: The Publisher Website.

164548.name: Schleierfall
164548.description:
(from the back of the book)
Again and again the heroes dream of Ras'Lamasshu, the city of cats. The ruler of the city, a real Sphinx, calls to warn them of a veiled conspiracy. No one knows yet what it's enigmatic words mean: Does the Sphinx give insights into a bleak future or can the heroes prevent the worst?

But everywhere in the country grows a subliminal threat: Anchopal, a holy place of the temple of Peraine is, is occupied by Novadis for many years now and King Arkos is eager to prove himself again as a hero and retake the city.
The dilapidated Llanka is still threatened by the gigantic Mauler, which makes each navigation attempt a risky business.
And nobody is safe in the shadows of Elburum, the white city.

Orderes by the Mondsilbersultana the heroes are looking for traces of her daughter Moghuli Dimiona, thought dead. If not for Dimiona herself, someone else is nurturing plans, and only the adventurers can unearth them.

Will these heroes again resist the temptations of Oron and reveal the secret of the conspiracy behind the veil? Or lead the manifold temptations directly in the lower hells? Who can be trusted who is playing a double game? Can the heroes finally look behind the veil or will the poison of the Arch Demoness finally ruin souls of the people forever?

164549.name: Trace Vector
164549.description:
You're lost in space.

Can you make it home? Deep in un-explored space, the small space craft Aurora finds itself unfathomably far from home. There's no hope of any Earth system finding this lost ship, but its presence has not gone un-noticed.
A neglected hyperspace network appears before it to point the only way home.

Hyperspace networks have hazards at every turn. Dead end paths, barriers, and worm holes that can send you back in time and space increase the danger; forcing you to think ahead and be prepared to consider your previous route through the network. Hyperspace is a strange place. Go forth brave pilot. Keep your wits in order, escape the neon labyrinths, and scavenge enough fuel to return home safely.

Source: The Developer Website.

164550.name: Inquisitors
164550.description:
From publisher blurb:

This edition of “Fantastic Feats” – a series of feats based around a certain theme or subject – is about Inquisitors, the grim and determined hunters of enemies of the faith.

Feats you will find inside are:

Alignment Damage - Do more base damage to those of opposing alingment
Divine Chance - Reroll dice associated with Inquisitor spells
Divine Spell Strength - Inquistior Spells are harder to resist
Effective Judgement - Level based effects of Judgements are more effective
Inquisitor Initiative - Increase your combat speed
Longer Bane Duration - Bane go on for longer
Sterner Gaze - Your righteous gaze is sterner and more powerful

164551.name: The Curse of Hallas Reach
164551.description:
From publisher blurb:

Within the shadows of the Fellspear Mountains, the outpost of Hallas Reach stands as a bastion against the foul things that stalk the night. The characters taking refuge within the walls of the outpost quickly find themselves under attack. In the aftermath, they find that things which were once dead can rise again, and there is always a price to pay for safety.

This adventure module is designed for character levels 3 to 5, although higher level characters may also find the adventure challenging.

This module is compatible with the world's most popular fantasy roleplaying game.

164552.name: Mines of Mars
164552.description:
Some suspected that Mars once harbored life.
There was a reason that it wasn’t ever found.

Mines of Mars is a procedural atmospheric mining game that is inspired by games like Metroid and Motherlode.
It is also a story based adventure game with dark secrets, great weapons, tons of different items, and a gorgeous world to explore.
The world of MoM is procedurally created, so that every time you play it, it will be a little different.
There are tons of different enemies, dark corridors, and a large variety of fauna and ambient creatures.

-Huge Procedurally generated underground world
-Night and Day system
-Dark secrets
-Atmospheric vibes
-Original Ambient Soundtrack by Evan Gipson
-Lots of flora and fauna
-Tons of Weapons and Items
-Coop Multiplayer
-Great storyline
-Gravity Mining!
-Huge Bosses

Source: The Developer Website.

164553.name: The Expansive Hospital
164553.description:
The Expansive Hospital is a board game in which players collaborate and compete to build a hospital with plastic blocks. Players have to build and treat patients at the same time, since the hospital is under constant expansion. There are many different kinds of patients and plastic blocks necessary to treat them. Designing the blocks is difficult because each player is responsible for one aspect of it: architect, engineer, contractor, nurse, facility manager or director. A poor design allows for earning more money but contributes to the hospital bankruptcy, in which case everybody loses the game. The gist of the game is to find a balance between the need to join forces and the greed for money.

The game design is based on a research conducted with three healthcare construction projects in the Netherlands commissioned by Pioneering. The research found that hospital design is often over schedule due to the conflicts of interests between the multiple parties involved. The game reproduces some of these conflicts, such as the engineer wanting to build more pipes than needed whiles the architect wanting to build a high rise building. If the conflict is not resolved between the players, patient satisfaction drops, together with the hospital income. Playing the game is an opportunity to learn the importance and the difficulties of designing for healthcare performance while having fun with the artificial conflict enactment.

164554.description: When playing Lewis & Clark: Cédrick Chaboussit, a promotional card for Lewis & Clark that features the game's designer, you can change any space in front of your Scout into a Mountain space if it is a River space, or into a River space if it is a Mountain. Use the Additional Route tokens to do so.
164554.name: Lewis & Clark: Cédrick Chaboussit

164555.description:
When playing Lewis & Clark: Uwe Rosenberg, a promotional card for Lewis & Clark, place one primary resource from your boats on it. At the end of your next Camp phase, after your Camp token has joined your Scout, take this resource back on your boats with one extra resource of the same type from the stock.

This action can be performed several times with various resources, e.g., if I activate this action three times, then place 1 fur and 2 wood on the card, after my next Camp phase I get 1 extra fur and 2 extra wood from the stock.
164555.name: Lewis & Clark: Uwe Rosenberg

164556.description: When playing Lewis & Clark: Martin Wallace, a promotional card for Lewis & Clark, you can move your Scout two spaces backwards on the route, then take one Canoe or one Horse from the stock. You cannot move your Scout further than St. Louis.
164556.name: Lewis & Clark: Martin Wallace

164557.description: When playing Lewis & Clark: Bauza & Cathala, a promotional card for Lewis & Clark, the active player takes randomly from the stock two primary resources per player. He can keep up to two resources for himself, placing them on his boats, then he gives the remaining resources to the player of his choice. This player takes up to two resources for himself, then gives the remaining resources to a player of his choice who has not yet received resources from this card. This process continues until all players have had a chance to take resources, at which time any remaining resources are returned to the stock.
164557.name: Lewis & Clark: Bauza & Cathala

164558.name: Grow: The Organic Building Game
164558.description:
Grow: The Organic Building Game is a three-dimensional building game in which 2-4 players guide the constant growth of a tree and compete by blossoming flowers around it. The game features a simple-to-learn set of rules, ideal for younger children, while offering a deep level of strategic nuance for more seasoned players. The core mechanisms have been designed to lightly simulate the life of an actual tree, complete with seasons, flowering, and even bugs! Players are given the ability to grow the board, or tree, in any way they choose – resulting in a unique and interesting play experience every time. The game's length is completely adjustable and can be set up to last anywhere between 20-60 minutes.

Each player is represented by a flower color. The goal of the game is to have the most point-worthy flowers of your chosen color before the seasons — represented by stacks of leaves — run out. To do this, you perform one of three simple actions: place a bud which will blossom into a complete flower the next turn, place a leaf to help guide the tree's growth, or use a beetle to attack or protect flowers. Since flowers can connect only to leaves, and leaves can connect together to form chains, points are determined by how many leaves each flower is from the nearest branch. The game also features several unique, seasonal events that can be very beneficial or harmful to the tree's growth including locusts swarm, bee pollination, and wood rot!

Grow: The Organic Building Game was created by Tap Pribbenow, Chris Hassebrook and Kyle Bromley on the idea of blending traditional sculpture with tabletop gaming, while providing a fun way of incorporating plant ecology.

164559.name: Marsh Locations
164559.description:
From publisher blurb:

Far from civilisation, adventurers discover locations that bring adventure, treasure...or death. Marsh Locations is a set of four isolated locations that are ideal for marshland adventures.

Marsh Locations is a printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Marsh Locations is a geomorphic set, comprising 5 10x10 square battlemaps which can be arranged in multiple layouts. Each tile can be used on its own, or can be matched with tiles from our Marshland geomorphic set.

Marsh Locations includes:

The Witch's House - near a tree decorated with skulls, the House of the Witch is best avoided. Some say there is a secret pit beneath the house.
The Adventurers Camp - making camp near the ruined walls of a house, at least the camp is dry
The Altar of the Druids - Ancient standing stones, the site of countless rituals
The Ancient Battlefield - The site of a battle in years past, the skeletal remains of the fallen lay sunken in the mire.




Uses:

The Witch's House - Seek the oracle for advice, kill (or help) the witch, visit the Shaman for medicine, track down the Hermit in the Marsh
The Adventurers Camp - ambush the hidden outlaws; sheltered grove for your party of travellers to rest overnight, travelling merchant
The Altar of the Druids - attack the witch at her summoning henge; ancient dolmens; magic standing stones; perform druidic rituals; fight monsters entering through this ancient portal
The Ancient Battlefield - seek a long lost weapon, resist the call of the voices of the dead, lay old ghosts to rest.




Also included is a set of 300dpi full size jpgs, for poster printing or VTT, in both gridded and non-gridded versions. (n.b. gridless version only available as full jpeg).

164560.name: Combinatorial Climber
164560.description:
This is a cooperative and combinatorial (perfect information, and no luck after the initial deal) climbing game for 2 players, that is also playable solitaire and has a competitive variant. In the game, players alternate turns drafting cards from a 5 by 4 grid of cards regular playing cards face up, with players taking cards from the lower part of the grid first, revealing other cards.

After each player has drafted 10 cards, play begins. Players attempt to play a single card, or a set of cards, each one must succeed the prior one played with a higher value, or greater amount of cards. Players then score points based upon how long of a run their last play was, with points lost for cards left in hands. Players also have jokers that act as wild cards, used to complete the going out in a single run.

The solitaire version works like the 2 player version, but a player plays both sides.

There is also a competitive version that utilizes the same drafting mechanism, but tweaks how cards are played.

164561.name: Evening Session Map Set #05
164561.description:
From publisher blurb:

Evening Session Map #05 consists of maps and handouts of The Swamp of Skull where mysterious temple is hidden

The set consists of:

a realm map (sketch made by a local townsfolk);
a location map (map of a swamp with temple);
a one temple drawing;
a drawing of wand of control

164563.description:
Set in the fantasy kingdom of Loria in an age of magic and Steampunk where Ponies, Pegasi and Unicorns live and fight alongside each other.

With the emergence of the Nagapon, a destructive race of pony-snake hybrids threaten Loria. The citizens must call upon the might of the Adventurers to eliminate enemies that threaten the security of the kingdom.

Buck: Legacy is a card based Dungeon Crawling RPG where players create their character from 3 pony races and 10 adventurer classes. Gameplay revolves around fighting monsters and earning gold pieces to purchase equipment to add to their inventory.

Players can be freely co-operative or competitive. Players aim to win by collecting the most medals, which are awarded for fighting monsters, travelling distance and defeating bosses.
164563.name: Buck: Legacy (1st Edition)

164564.description:
In the fast-moving, easy-to-learn game Giant, players draft cards that can become troops in their army to fight six giants that have attacked the kingdom. The giants are large stand-up boards with punch-out circles representing hits to the head, torso, arm, or feet.

Tokens are shaken in a cup and placed in a pool on the table. One side of the tokens is a color matching each player with a number, and the other side has a magic, weapon, or gold symbol. Players draft tokens With the gold they hire their army, with the magic they fuel their wizards, and with the weapon they activate their fighters. Once a giant is hit, the striking player gets the punch token. When a giant is dead, players roll dice, based on their punch tokens, for victory points or more fuel tokens. If the numbers showing on the tokens when they come out of the cup equal 7 for any particular player, that player has a troop killed in combat.
164564.name: Giant

164565.name: Mechanisms For Tabletop Roleplaying
164565.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a compilation of five articles for refining your rules. The articles are:

The Countdown Stack is basic advice on using token stacks as timers in your play.
Temptation Dice gives an easy method for handling extra effort, temptation by dark forces, and other interesting pieces.
Action Scenery lays out seven options for high action using set pieces.
The Wrath Count is a simple tracking method for “aggro” in your game.
Escalated changes your whole game into a vicious soap opera.




Action Scenery is a new article - the others appeared originally on the Amagi Games website, and have been collected, formatted, and edited for easier reading and use here.

164566.name: McJohny's
164566.description:
Grab your paper hat and a pair of pocketless slacks! You and your friends just started work at the world's most popular crab-based fast food chain, "McJohny's". In the kitchen, time doesn't stop. We're cranking out crabs at full speed! While you man the grill, your pal is already starting up the bike to deliver his first order on time. You can't afford to be the weak link in this chain!

McJohny's is an action-packed party game for 3 to 6 players that takes about 20 minutes. The game is comprised of different mini-games. Each shift, one player is the manager and decides who has to do what. Together they try to satisfy some of the four customers that come to the restaurant. Employees are allowed to work only one minute because of very strong unions. Also due to the low budget, there aren't always wages for everyone, so not all of the staff wants to cooperate.

In the end you count up your acquired little crabs — the only currency usable at McJohny's — and trade them in at the restaurant gift shop. Maybe you'll earn enough to go on holidays to Crab Island!

164567.name: Steam Powered: Devices of the Mechanical Age

rpgseries.36489: The Open Gaming Store Free RPG Day 2016

164567.description:
From publisher blurb:


Put some STEAM into your campaign!

This book is a GREAT compliment to your "Pure Steam", "Thunderscape", or homebrew steam-powered campaign.

Inside you'll find:

A discussion on steam-enhanced adventures and settings
Rules for using steam-cells to power weapons or other items
Several new steam-themed weapons including the steamsaw, grappling gun, hedge-trimmer, longsword revolver, steamguns, and splatterballs, a new kind of ammunition for steamguns.
Several items of misc. equipment, such as portable cameras, clockwork toys that spew smoke and grease, clockwork boilers, and more
New magic items including enchanted music boxes
10 new vehicles, including the awesome climbing tank, crawling castle, steam tractor, steam submarine (and more)
3 steamy hazards for PCs to try to avoid

164568.name: Never Alone

videogamehonor.30517: 2014 The Game Awards Best Impact of the Year Nominee

164568.description:
Where nature challenges life in the extreme. Where death lies waiting in the cold. Where you must explore the fantastical world of Iñupiaq stories to help a young girl save her people from an endless blizzard.

Source: The Developer Website.

164570.name: Taxi
164570.description: The players start at the cinema and have to get each of their 4 meeples into one of 13 house entrance doors. The meeples can walk (slow) or use 1 of 4 taxis (fast), if they can get one. The first player, who gets all 4 of his meeples home, wins the game.

164571.description:
This promo pack contains two new cards for Sheriff of Nottingham:


Arcane Scrolls
You cannot collect bonuses at the end of the game.

Feast Plate
Represents any of the 4 basic legal goods
164571.name: Sheriff of Nottingham: Dice Tower Promo Pack

164572.name: Chuubo's Marvelous Wish Granting Engine

rpghonor.26790: 2014 Golden Geek RPG of the Year Nominee

164572.description:
From the back of the book:

From the back of the core book:

Chuubo’s Marvelous Wish-Granting Engine RPG — a game of heroic innocents growing up against a backdrop of strange events and haunting landscapes.

Come drink tea, explore your new home, and fight strange horrors. Come argue over television shows, shop for the latest thing, read books mined out from the literary veins under the earth, and challenge Death. Meet the reborn sun. Feast on giant monsters. Stress over your homework, your family, and love.

Welcome to a game that’s designed to run away with you. To take the little things you think and do in play and turn them into ever-escalating stories.

164573.name: Astroblaster (Web Browser)
164573.description:
User Summary

In this vertically scrolling shooter you try to kill enemies before they kill you. The game is broken up into separate waves. Gain power ups and use your nuke to destroy all onscreen enemies. Last as long as you can and get as many points as you can.

164574.name: Breakout (Web Browser)
164574.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Breakout.




User Summary

A web browser version of the classic arcade game Breakout. Move your paddle on the bottom of the screen. Hit the ball and keep it from getting past the paddle. Get the power ups to help along the way.

164575.name: Cannon Bods
164575.description:
User Summary

In this fixed screen shooting game you fire pirates out of cannons at other pirates that are parachuting into the water. But be careful! The pirates you fire can only hit parachuting pirates that are identical. Hold the left mouse button to charge up the shot. Get as many points as you can, and try not to lose any lives!

164576.name: Marvin Spectrum
164576.description:
User Summary

Jump, duck and dive to avoid the obstacles. But beware, even if you successfully avoid an obstacle, but are the wrong color you will still get hit. Change color between green, blue, red and violet. Score as many points as you can for successfully clearing obstacles. The longer you play the more colors you will have to shift between to clear obstacles.

164577.name: - Dodge -
164577.description:
User Summary

In this fixed screen game you control the square and must avoid the circles! There are lots of circles to avoid so be careful! Collect shield items to protect the square. The longer you play the more points you get!

164578.description:
THE SITUATION

The time is 0515 hrs, 15 June 1941

The British offensive, code-named Operation Battleaxe, began at 0515 hours, June 15th, 1941. The aim was to overrun the Axis frontier positions, defeat the Axis armored reserves, and then drive west to relieve Tobruk. The attack came to grief in large part because of the deadly fire of German 88s well-emplaced in several key positions, but most famously at the key defile of Halfaya Pass, forever after known as Hellfire Pass.

THE GAME

Hellfire Pass is a World War II simulation of the British Battleaxe offensive on 15-17 June, 1941. Operation Brevity is also included as an introductory scenario. This game marks a long-awaited, new chapter for the fast-playing, operational-level system enjoyed by many in Beda Fomm – a classic Frank Chadwick game design. The popularity of the game system is its blend of simple gaming mechanics that delivers fast-paced, nail-biting action suitable for solitaire or competition play.

Fans of Beda Fomm will be pleased to learn that the original game system has been retained, while also evolving and elaborating on it to best capture the protracted nature of the battles in this game. Both the Brevity and Battleaxe offensives were examples of protracted combat where both sides were challenged to sustain their efforts in the field while also maneuvering aggressively over a wider landscape. New rules covering Supply, Repairs and Regrouping, and Morale Recovery represent additions that speak to that need to sustain operations in the face of losses. The game also reflects the greater availability of certain weapons – primary AT guns.

Now available for preorder from Consim Press
164578.name: Hellfire Pass

164579.description:
THIS JUST IN…

A dark cloud looms over Zeta City, one that speaks with a forked tongue and tells of ill omens and other generally bad stuff. In the wake of the retirement of Fastodon, the World’s Fastest Mammoth, all manner of foul evil has emerged to wreak havoc. From sinister deities once relegated to myth to arcane menaces who have hovered at the fringes of our mundane world, all have been waiting for just such an opportunity and now return with visions of conquest. After all, one less Champion means one less obstacle in the way of their nefarious machinations. But hope is not lost! As we have learned in recent news, ambitious heroes eager to prove their mettle are patrolling the rooftops and alleys. Among them are practitioners of the mystic arts and noble gods from great pantheons, each able to face the rising tide of villainy for the sake of all that is good and right. A day of decisive battle is descending upon Zeta City, and from it shall emerge...

The Stuff of Legend!

Heroes Wanted: The Stuff of Legend expands the Heroes Wanted universe as Supernatural and Mythic heroes join the fray, while mechanisms such as feats and curses introduce all-new tactics and the price for using them. All that along with even more heroes, villains, Quirks, and two new scenarios will add even more variety and complexity to your Heroes Wanted experience. So, are you ready to step up and be more than just a hero and become a legend?

RIGHT WRONGS. UPHOLD JUSTICE. BECOME A LEGEND.
164579.name: Heroes Wanted: The Stuff of Legend

164580.name: Articulate Sex
164580.description:
Articulate Sex is a fun and educational sex themed adult word game!

​Articulate Sex is an adult game that consists of 1000+ words related to sex. Challenge your friends’ knowledge about sex and how well they can describe it!

How to play instruction cards are included inside the pack and on the official website. The game has been designed to integrate with other word based board games, such as Articulate!, Balderdash, and Taboo.

Each card consists of words in six categories:
Object - anything physical used for sex or to create arousal.
Action - sex activities or positions.
World location - places where adults have sex or go to find sex.
Person - porn stars, sex symbols, influential people, or people types.
Nature - human physiology, emotions, and psychology.
Random - anything related to sex!

The words in this game aim to be inclusive of all gender identities and sexual orientations. Only commonly legal activities are included.

164581.name: Dex
164581.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – IN BETA




This game is in Beta and has not been fully released yet.




Explore the dark alleys of Harbor Prime and a host of diverse locations in both physical reality and the wild reaches of cyberspace.

Discover the truth behind an enigmatic AI striving to reach the Singularity, a theoretical “event horizon” in which artificial intelligence will surpass human intelligence and all bets about the future will be off.

How will you play your part in the story?

Source: The Developer Website.

164582.name: Star Wars: Force and Destiny (Beta)
164582.description:
From Fantasy Flight's Website:

The Star Wars: Force and Destiny beta is a limited edition, 256-page softcover rulebook, and it includes all the information players and GMs need to begin epic campaigns, full of personal conflicts and Force powers, all set within the Star Wars galaxy and drawing upon one of its most resonant themes.

Force and Destiny allows players to follow in the footsteps of those nigh-mythical guardians of peace and justice—the Jedi Knights. Your characters possess the rare and dangerous ability to touch and use the Force, the energy field that binds and surrounds every living thing. It is up to them whether they use this power to try and fight the forces of injustice and oppression, or if they give into the darkness and temptation within and become agents of evil.

164583.name: Eternal Champions
164583.description:
From Wikipedia:

An ominscent being known as the Eternal Champion predicts that mankind will soon fade to existence due to the untimely and unjust deaths of key individuals throughout history who were destined for greatness. Seeking to restore balance to the world, the Eternal Champion gathers these souls from time moments before their deaths to participate in a fighting tournament. The victor will be able to change their fate and bring balance to the universe, whilst the losers will be forced to live out their deaths just as history intended.
Unlike most fighting games, or video games in general, there are no characters in this game that are "bad" or "evil". Each character has been chosen because they are either inherently good, or they have the potential to do great good and change the course of history for the better. Despite the ability to kill opponents in this game, this is not relevant to the story. Much like games such as Mortal Kombat (which pioneered finishing moves in fighting games), the game's "Overkills" are not canon and simply a gameplay element for the enjoyment of the player. It is actually revealed in a few character endings that some of the fighters had become allies or friends during the course of the tournament.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eternal_Champions

164585.name: Time Fight
164585.description:
Time Fight is a gladiatorial combat game where your fighters can travel through time, revive dead fighters and change the game's history.

In Time Fight, each player controls a squad of 3 Fighters. Players then move their Fighters across space-time, leaving behind a trails of their past selves. These past selves can be intersected, fought and killed, altering the history of the game so far.

For instance, if a Fighter is killed, another Fighter in their squad can go back in time and kill their killer before they were killed, reviving them.

Play Summary

Each Player starts with 3 Fighters on a 2-dimensional board (one dimension is space, one is time). Each turn, players activate a square with one of their Fighters, which either activates combat (if enemies are in the square), or allows that Fighter to move. Combat is decided via secretly selected cards for each Fighter. Some moves allow the Fighters to travel in time, but will, over time, lock off the board to Time Travel, preventing others from doing the same.

Fighters can also grab items in the square they're in, which will give them extra abilities in their future.

Players get Victory Points for:

having living Fighters,
killing other Fighters,
having Fighters with long timelines,
travelling backwards in time; and
grabbing VP items on the board




The Fight ends when an entire squad is dead, most of the board is locked, or a player reaches 8 Victory Points.

164586.name: The Prophet: A Dungeon World Playbook
164586.description:
From publisher blurb:

You rest your head on your hands, gazing forth at the sun setting over the horizon. The last moments of sunlight slip from your skin like a shade down a window.

A whisper tickles your ears as it is carried by the wind. Fate’s words gently caress your mind.

“It is time to go forth my child, and guide others as I have guided you.”

Will you guide others along the path? Create chaos and drive tension between Fate and the mortal world? Influence your own mass of followers? Choose your own fate as... the Prophet!

164588.name: Intrigo: Muiters van de Zeven Zeeën
164588.description:
In Intrigo the players are pirates on a pirate ship. Half of the ship's crew is loyal to the captain, but the other half is plotting to kill the captain and take control of the ship. Who will come out of this struggle victoriously?

At the start of the game each player will receive a card. On this card is a unique role and a team indication (either red or blue). Many of the roles have some sort of special power. Players do not show their role card to others. Only one player will reveal his role immediately: this is the player which has the captain role (and who is on the blue team).
The blue team wins if they succeed in killing all of the players in the red team. The red team wins if they succeed in killing the captain. However, as long as the blue player with the bodyguard role is alive, the captain cannot be killed by red players.

The game plays in night and day phases, just like in Werewolf. In the first night, the captain and bodyguard will get to know each other. Also, the players on the red team will get to know each other, but only partially: one player on the red team is the team leader. This player will open his eyes ("wake up") and will make eye contact with other red players one-by-one. This means that the red team leader knows who all of the red players are, but all the other red players will only know the red team leader but none of the other team mates.

In the game, players are eliminated at night by roles that become active then (usually red players). Players are also eliminated by day, as at the end of each day usually one player will be nominated to "walk the plank" (and will thus be eliminated). The captain can never be nominated to walk the plank. There are various player roles which can perform special night and day actions. These actions include finding out more about other players, kill them, or protect them.

What sets this game apart from Werewolf is that most of the night actions require the player performing them to actually touch the player to which it is directed. This not only makes it harder to kill players further away from you, it also increases chances that some kind of noise or movement will be felt by the other players (which have their eyes closed during the nights). This in turn gives players during the day 'evidence' to accuse other players of being on the red team, and thus a good candidate to 'walk the plank'!

Intrigo shares game mechanisms with Werewolf (e.g., two teams that battle for victory, day/night phases, hidden roles with special powers) and BANG! (hidden roles and only one role is known to all players).

The game is language-dependent: the texts on the cards are in the Dutch language, and currently there is only a Dutch rule set available.

boardgamehonor.26779: 2014 Golden Geek Best Children's Board Game Nominee

164589.description:
Roar-a-Saurus is a beautifully illustrated, family friendly, multi-player dino battle with "easy" and "challenge" modes.

In "easy", players roll their battle dice as quickly as they can to attack their neighbors, heal themselves, or blow up all the other players. Gameplay is fast and furious, and with super simple rules, everyone can get in on the action as quickly as you can take the game out of the box.

In "challenge" mode, players have more options, but gameplay is still easy to learn and quick to play. Power-Ups make your dino more powerful by increasing its offense or defense. Customize your dino with nine different Power-Ups into a offensive dino of destruction or an armor clad defensive dino of doom — but you'll still need to be quick as play is always real-time...
164589.name: Roar-a-Saurus

164590.name: Fruit Mix
164590.description:
In Fruit Mix, a.k.a. GYÜMI, players have to use their skills to collect as many points as possible by compiling fruit sequences. The only thing you need is perceptual and reliable memory since you can always see only the topmost cards of your sets!

The game provides different experience depending on the number of players: with 2 players it is a brain burner and you can count on some tense competition, with 3-4-5 players the game provides much more tactical possibilities and players need to pay more attention to the gameplay – only of course, if they want to win –, while with 6-7-8 players it turns into a fun party game.

Players try to collect sequences of the different fruits. Players can start any number of fruit sequences, but they can only have one sequence of each kind of fruit (e.g. they cannot have two plum sequences on their own playing area), so they can compile 6 different sequences at most. Your aim is to get all 5 of the collected fruits with different numbers (from 1 to 5). If somebody collected a sequence which does not meet these demands, they will get less points or none. (If you collected from 1 to 5 – 11 points, if number 1 is missing from a sequence – 0 point, if a number occurs more than once in a sequence – 0 point!)

The player who collects the highest number of points using their excellent memory skills will be the winner!

164591.name: Finding the Fallen
164591.description:
From publisher blurb:

2085. Humanity faces extinction. Alien insects from the edge of our solar system, long hidden behind the façade of reality, descend to enslave us. Hordes of unspeakable horrors roll out from Central Asia, laying waste to anything in their path. The church of the fish-god scours the world for lost occult secrets to unleash terrible forces. Dead gods awaken and turn their dreadful eyes toward the Earth. And within hides a cancer, eating away at the very heart of the New Earth Government.

This is the Aeon War. This is the time of CthulhuTech.

Tagers helping to find the Circlet of Ghabbaz and the mysterious machinations of the Chrysalis Corporation have been abducted. Whoever has that kind of power can keep Tagers prisoner, and worse. Leave no one behind.

Mom’s Coming to Dinner 3 – Finding the Fallen I:

Is a turn-key adventure, ready-to-run, with most everything you need.
Takes Characters on a quest to locate missing Tagers, who are on the same path as they.
Is the fourth adventure in the epic Mom’s Coming to Dinner campaign.
Is usable in CthulhuTech Organized Play framework – take your Character from game to game.

164592.description:
Can't Stop: Rollin' Down the Highway is an expansion for Can't Stop by George "Bud" Sauer and Jeff Horger that adds 72 tiles that are placed on the Can't Stop board before play starts. (You will need the base game of Can't Stop to play.) When a player stops he checks each of his white markers and if there is a tile in the space they follow the rules to resolve the tile (including revealing any new tiles). The tiles have several different abilities including:


Interstate Markers - allows a player to adjust die roll once on a future turn
Traffic Hazards - forces player to make one more roll to win the spot in the column
Detour - causes player to move white marker left or right one column
Fast Lane - moves the players white marker one space up the column
Traffic Delay - causes player to move white marker one space down the column
Map - allows the player to use one additional white marker for next turn only
Roundabout - forces player to move their white marker one space up, down, left or right
Lost - forces player to use only two white markers on their next time
164592.name: Can't Stop: Rollin' Down the Highway

164593.description:
The goal? Build a path in your color across the long side of the board... before your opponent. Each turn, you can place a double-sided piece in your color OR a permanent piece in your opponent’s color. Why would you give your opponent a permanent piece? Because doing so flips the touching pieces, allowing you to dynamically alter the game. The first player to connect opposite ends wins.

Louis Lafair invented Pathwayz when he was 11 years old.
164593.name: Pathwayz

164594.name: Legacy Of Lies
164594.description:
From publisher blurb:

The First Ones have been planning to conquer and destroy the nations of Exodus. A Khaynite named Arem'shehr had an inspired plan to do just that... Only a few heroes stand in his way, the same one that inspired the plot. This interactive adventure is story binding and the results determine next years' campaign theme.

A NeoExodus Legacies adventure for characters level 3-6.

This Adventure contains two mini-dungeons in addition to the storyline event!

164595.name: Calamity Mine
164595.description:
From publisher blurb:

Two decades ago rival mining companies bickered over the rights to Calamity Mine. When blood was not being shed during these skirmishes, the mine itself claimed many lives. Cave-ins, flooding tunnels, and volatile gases plagued operations at the mine. Eventually The Rusted Hammer Mining Company shut the claim down, boarded the entrance up, and sold it to Cyrus Milnar nine years ago. Cyrus left the claim boarded up, but recently noticed activity near the closed mine. He seeks brave folk to ferret out what is going on up there.

A Pocket-Sized Encounter compatible with the Swords & Wizardry rules system for 1st to 3rd level character.

Pocket-Sized Encounters from Iron Tavern Press are shorter scenarios designed to be dropped into an existing campaign with minimal preparation. Use them for shorter sessions, provide your players with choices that won’t derail your campaign or even as a launching point for a new campaign path.

Included in this product are:

New Relic
Multiple adventure hooks
Location based encounter area maps (GM, Player versions in grid and gridless format)
Seeds for expanding the adventure
Random misfortune table

164596.name: The Letter C
164596.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ever wonder what a cotset is? Where the word "claymore" comes from? Or just how many types of claqueurs there are?

Alphabet Soup is a comprehensive guide to words commonly (and uncommonly) found in games or used by gamers. It provides quick, easy definitions in lexicon form: gaming terms, definitions, historical context, mythological terms. It even gives gamemasters advice on how they can use them in their games. It works like an encyclopedia of random bits, only these random bits are things I think are interesting for gamemasters.

Flip it open randomly to discover that a cob is a sturdy horse, then introduce one into your games. The letter B covers everything from Clicker to Corsair; from Cavell to a rant about the Chaos Factor.

164597.name: Wilderness Adventures
164597.description:
From the Publisher:

Back to Nature

Is a dungeon absolutely essential to killing things and taking their stuff? Not really! Every fantasy hero spends at least as much time trekking through the wilds as skulking underground – and of course the great outdoors is big, which spells opportunity. So don't let the "Dungeon" in GURPS Dungeon Fantasy 16: Wilderness Adventures fool you. This weighty work gives you the tools you need to show Nature who's boss:


Adventurers. Learn which fantasy professions are wilderness-ready, how to whip pasty city boys and tunnel-crawlers into shape, and what Allies and henchmen to bring on the trip.
Equipment. Buy new wilderness gear – including boats, carts, and other vehicles – and find out what old stuff is worth its place in your pack.
Tasks and feats. Exploit detailed rules for camping, foraging, travel, and mapping . . . wilderness stunts and movement . . . scouting and tracking . . . and of course outdoor combat!
Challenges and dangers. Know your surroundings, from purely static terrain and weather, through dynamic hazards like avalanches and tornadoes, to deliberate traps and ambushes.
The big picture. Discover how to work all this into an existing campaign or a new one – with practical advice on matters of setting and scale.
And more! Getting lost, aerial scouting, mounted combat, making stone axes, despoiling nature, being shipwrecked, druidic abilities in the wild . . . if it's wilderness-themed, it's here.


Whatever your outdoor needs might be, GURPS Dungeon Fantasy 16: Wilderness Adventures is sure to help you dig your GURPS Dungeon Fantasy campaign out of a hole!

164598.name: Sabidurius
164598.description:
From official web page (translated from Spanish):

"Sabidurius is a board game based on the words, definitions, imagination and writing. Unlike other games where knowledge is crucial in Sabidurius age and cultural level doesn't care.

Sabidurius rewards imagination, your ability to create definitions that sound convincing without worring whether they are true or not.

And since anyone can make up a definition, anyone can play Sabidurius."

The game-play is simple, all players must create definitions for words (a selected set of unusual words from the dictionary), then players vote for the definition that they think it's correct. If a player votes your invented definition, you get points. If you vote for the correct definition, you get points. So simple, so fun.

164599.name: Raid on the Emperor's Hand (Pathfinder)

rpgissuearticle.136596: Review: Isles of Plunder: Raid on the Emperor’s Hand

164599.description:
From publisher blurb:

With a Great Prize Comes Great Peril in this 8th-level pirate adventure!

A richly laden imperial merchant ship caught on a sandbar presents a tempting target to a crew of daring pirates. Her holds may be bursting with swag, but they are also laden with soldiers, with a cruel captain at the helm. At any moment the sails of her imperial escorts may appear on the horizon, but your scurvy scalawags have found her first. A daring assault might bring you more plunder than you've seen in a year, but many pirates greedy for gold have lingered too long over a prize they thought safe, until an enemy fleet sent them to a watery grave. Can the PCs stage a lightning raid on the immobilized ship and get away with their ill-gotten gains? Dare they risk a Raid on the Emperor’s Hand?

164600.description:
Perfume sites are testing on monkeys everywhere, and you and your friends aren't going to stand by so some celebrity can smell like a million bucks. But while navigating through the lab to get back to the monkeys, one of your friends knocks over a beaker of The Competitive Edge. Due to the current side effect, everyone is now under the impression that this is a competition and whomever frees the most monkeys wins.

Monkeys Need Love Too is a fast paced, action card game where you compete to free as many monkeys as possible while at the same time preventing your opponents from doing the same.

Game play is divided into two phases. In the main phase, Flinging Poo, players take turns around the table. A player's turn starts off by drawing your hand to reload back up to 5 cards. If you draw banana cards, they are set aside and you keep drawing. Next the player has the option to play one monkey card and one action card. Afterwards they must feed their monkeys using the bananas they have stored. If a monkey can't be fed, he/she is discarded. And lastly, the player may discard any cards out of their hand in the hopes of drawing better ones or more bananas next turn.

The game is over when some plays the action card "No Coco, No!!". If successful, this ends the Flinging Poo phase and triggers the To the Trees phase. Everyone must now draw for their end fate. Do they escape? Must they sacrifice some of their monkeys to do so? Do they find new monkeys while on the way out? In the end, the person who freed the most monkeys without being caught is the winner of the game.
164600.name: Monkeys Need Love Too

164601.description:
In Shut Up & Take My Money, you take on the role of fledging game designers using crowdfunding to pitch your game ideas. Be the most creative and convincing player to become the next superstar of the gaming world!

Each round, the players combine Idea Cards with one Project Card to create different games.
